chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt Anthony Verbunker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
*Costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation
*If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
*Absolute sobriety
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*No contact with the Village of Eagle, the Town of Eagle or the Eagle Police Department unless in the event of an emergency
*No contact with any Victims listed in the criminal complaint
*Domestic violence counseling through a State certified batterer's intervention program
*Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

records.addlTxt:
Letter from the Department of Corrections requesting a review of the judgment of conviction in this case.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/26/2022 - No action will be taken as the DOC is not a party to this action.**

8:35 AM Defendant Kurt Anthony Verbunker in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Kurt Anthony Verbunker.  Attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for jury status, but the parties have reached a resolution.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

Court orders the following:
COUNT 1: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

6  YEARS OF IMPRISONMENT (Credit: 41 Days)
3    YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
3    YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Consecutive to:  Any other sentence. 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

TERM ON PROBATION:  3 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  the Village of Eagle, the Town of Eagle, or the Eagle Police Department, unless in the event of an emergency; 
*No contact with any Victims listed in the criminal complaint; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*Domestic Violence Counseling through a State-certified batterer's intervention program; 
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate;

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

********************************************
COUNT 2: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  9 MONTHS, Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.
Consecutive to Count 1 if revoked; 

TERM ON PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 1; 

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

The trial is removed from the calendar.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:34 AM Defendant Kurt Anthony Verbunker in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review of Competency Evaluation.
Court also called 19CF81 for reasons as stated on the record. 

Attorney Rypel is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctors report.

The Court finds the Defendant competent to proceed.
The suspension of proceedings is lifted. 
Defense has received discovery, but not an offer.
Atty Rypel will inform the Administrative Law Judge.
  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
SEALED:  Cover Letter for the Competency Evaluation.
SEALED:  Competency Evaluation prepared by Dr. Katelyn Grusecki
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 4/08/2022
Review hearing on May 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Kurt Anthony Verbunker in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review hearing.
A competency report was filed by Dr. Neiss.
Atty Rypel has reviewed the document with the Defendant.
Defense does not contest the findings of the report.
State and Defense request that the Court follow her recommendation.
The Court adopts the findings of the report. The Defendant is not competent. The Court cannot make a finding of restorability at this time.

The Court will order an in-patient evaluation so the Court may make a finding of the restorability of competency. 
The Waukesha County Sheriff will transport the Defendant to the facility. 
 

  Review hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

09:10 AM Defendant Kurt Anthony Verbunker in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties are in agreement to have this matter heard by Branch 10 today. 
Atty Rypel requests an order for competency pursuant to Sec 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as outpatient basis within 30 days.  Court sets a review hearing.
